segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, File System (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the file system for an entire computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, File System (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the file system for an entire computer.

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, File System (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the file system for an entire computer.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, File System (Global Object Access Auditing), which enables you to configure a global system access control list (SACL) on the file system for an entire computer.

segment.source: If you select the Configure security check box on the policy’s property page, you can add a user or group to the global SACL.
segment.target: If you select the Configure security check box on the policy’s property page, you can add a user or group to the global SACL.

segment.source: This enables you to define computer system access control lists (SACLs) per object type for the file system.
segment.target: This enables you to define computer system access control lists (SACLs) per object type for the file system.

segment.source: The specified SACL is then automatically applied to every file system object type.
segment.target: The specified SACL is then automatically applied to every file system object type.

segment.source: If both a file or folder SACL and a global SACL are configured on a computer, the effective SACL is derived by combining the file or folder SACL and the global SACL.
segment.target: If both a file or folder SACL and a global SACL are configured on a computer, the effective SACL is derived by combining the file or folder SACL and the global SACL.

segment.source: This means that an audit event is generated if an activity matches either the file or folder SACL or the global SACL.
segment.target: This means that an audit event is generated if an activity matches either the file or folder SACL or the global SACL.

segment.source: This policy setting must be used in combination with the File System security policy setting under Object Access.
segment.target: This policy setting must be used in combination with the File System security policy setting under Object Access.

segment.source: For more information, see Audit File System.
segment.target: For more information, see Audit File System.
